project.description:
This test runs for now on tul4, but it can be moved to any other system. Cards are auto detected, tests are performed automatically. Problematic, could be that this must not run in parallel but wait for the adjacent test to complete.
We need libcxl installed properly to make this work. If we use the original GenWQE version of the card, the genese_card.ko driver must be installed and a proper udev rule should be installed too, to get user-space permission to use the card.

hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
# # FIXME Well, well, this must not run in parallel!! #
# # Set unique target directory such that parallel builds do not disturb each other. # Well, we might to clean up those from time to time ... # TARGET_DIR="${JOB_NAME}-${GIT_BRANCH}-${BUILD_NUMBER}" export TARGET_DIR=`echo $TARGET_DIR | sed -e 's/\//-/g'` echo "TARGET_DIR=${TARGET_DIR}"
# # fpgaaccel.git # This procedure is not trouble free. The checkout without asking for a # password is not fully automatable. This is a problem! Trying to circumvent # that with a script using my account, but even with that it asked me one time # for a password. I wonder when this is forgotten and it breaks again ... # #~/bin/fpgaaccel_checkout.sh #cp -r genwqe-user fpgaaccel_genwqe
echo "Copy/build the code ..." ssh fpga@tul4 dmesg -T ssh fpga@tul4 mkdir -p ${TARGET_DIR} ssh fpga@tul4 tar xfvz /usr/local/genwqe/genwqe.tar.gz -C ${TARGET_DIR} rsync -avz --delete genwqe-user fpga@tul4:${TARGET_DIR}/genwqe/ wget http://corpus.canterbury.ac.nz/resources/cantrbry.tar.gz scp cantrbry.tar.gz fpga@tul4:${TARGET_DIR}/genwqe/genwqe-user ssh fpga@tul4 make -C ${TARGET_DIR}/genwqe
echo "Execute standard tests ..." ssh fpga@tul4 << EOF cd ${TARGET_DIR}/genwqe
for a in CAPI GENWQE ; do for card in \`./genwqe-user/tools/genwqe_find_card -A\${a}\`; do echo "TESTING \${a} CARD \${card} ZEDC TESTS" ./tests/zedc/scripts/zedc_test.sh -A\$a -C\$card -M full if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo "ERROR: Problem detected!" exit 1 fi
echo "TESTING \${a} CARD \${card} ZLIB TESTS" ./tests/zlib/scripts/zlib_test_all.sh -A$\a -C\$card -I -HH if [ $? -ne 0 ]; then echo "ERROR: Problem detected!" exit 1 fi
done done EOF
echo "Wrap results ..." ssh fpga@tul4 << EOF tar cfz ${TARGET_DIR}.tar.gz ${TARGET_DIR} echo ".... rm -rf ${TARGET_DIR}" rm -rf ${TARGET_DIR} EOF
